results.title: Erikson on Erikson on the Community
results.creator_credit: Thomas Sand and Parents' Magazine Films
results.brief_description: This is edited from filmed and recorded conversation between Erik Erikson and students. He talks about the community and its place in modern society Credits include: production manager-Carl Zucker; photographer-Stephen Bower; editor-Laurence Solomon; sound-Jeffrey Hayes

results.title: Epilepsy: Yes! You can help
results.brief_description: Affecting one or two people in every 100, epilepsy manifests itself through three different kinds of seizures - tonic colonic, absence and complex partial. Using dramatised re-enactments and discussions with sufferers, this short program describes what it’s like to suffer an attack and what you can do if you witness one. Narrated by Nina Landis.

results.title: Enya: Moonshadows
results.creator_credit: Michael Geoghegan, M-Oceans Pictures and Warner Music UK
results.brief_description: This compilation of film clips is a must-see for Enya fans. The film clips add to the dreamy qualities inherent in Enya’s music style. Featuring some of her soundtracks made for film, the compilation includes: Orinoco Flow, Exile, Storm in Africa, Evening Falls, Caribbean Blue.

results.title: England to Australia in under nine days
results.brief_description: A Fox-Movietone newsreel (vol. 3, ep. 19) from 1932 documenting the arrival of Charles Scott, the first person to fly from England to Australia in under nine days - as the title suggests. He lands in Sydney and is greeted by Sir Charles Kingsford Smith and welcoming crowd. Similar events in Brisbane are also shown.

results.title: What would happen if...? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
First grade children sort materials, and compare wood with sawdust. Second grade children experiment with objects and are introduced to the terms interaction, sub-systems and variables. Third graders find which part of a mixture changes the colour of a BTB/vinegar solution, and experiment with changing variables.

results.title: Let's try it (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
Fifth grade children, working with the communities unit, observed crickets in their terraria and set up experiments to find out what the crickets eat. Later children observe frogs eating some of their crickets and so on. The children’s experiences provide background for the introduction of the concept of a community.

results.title: Endoscopic study of the prostate = Les Adenomes de la prostate etude endoscopique
results.brief_description: This film highlights the disease issues related to prostate medical condition focussing on the various issues arising with pre and post operation. In medical linguistics it explores the diverse complications of the prostatic cavity.

results.title: End of the line
results.brief_description: This film was shot in a small industrial village, in North West England, called Heap Bridge. The film examines this village, its main industry being papermaking, and its history that goes back to the Industrial Revolution over 150 years ago.
results.description: This film was shot in a small industrial village, in North West England, called Heap Bridge. The film examines this village, its main industry being papermaking, and its history that goes back to the Industrial Revolution over 150 years ago.
